David Hollaz 1648–1713

Most renowned for his systematic text, “Examen Theologicum Acroamaticum,” Hollaz was a respected pastor and doctor of theology during the period known as the Lutheran Orthodoxy.

Biography

The Restoration and Resurrection of the Dead (Part I)

David Hollaz uses a question-and-answer format to cover the doctrine of the restoration and resurrection of the dead.

Read

The Restoration and Resurrection of the Dead (Part II)

David Hollaz uses a question-and-answer format to cover the doctrine of the restoration and resurrection of the dead.

Read

The Highest Mystery of the Most Holy Trinity in the Old Testament

David Hollaz demonstrates that the Old Testament clearly testifies to the Trinity of divine persons.

Read

Baptism and the Means of Salvation

Hollaz address the topic of baptism as a conferring means of salvation.

Read

Studium fosters the study of the confessional languages at Martin Luther College and in Wisconsin Evangelical Lutheran Synod by publishing original, English translations of historic Latin and German resources drawn from the Lutheran tradition in both Europe and the United States.
